bio: Olá! I’m Marcio, a software engineer hailing from sunny Portugal. My journey into the world of programming started with the love for videos games and the dream of one day designing my own. This lead me into learning how to code and eventually become a software developer.

Nowadays, my interests lie in application development, mainly on the backend spectrum. Although I also enjoy video game development. I consider myself a well-organised, goal-oriented and hardworking person with a creative side. I'm always eager to improve my skills and learn about new technologies that pique my interest.

portfolio.title: Nutris App
portfolio.desc: A web app to assist and improve the workflow of nutritionists. Nutris’ features ease the process of scheduling appointments, keep track of clients’ progress, create personalized meal plans and nutrition charts. Clients can also track their progress, check their food plans and appointments.

portfolio.title: Multiplayer Game System
portfolio.desc: A massively multiplayer online game system capable of handling hundreds of clients and running multiple game sessions simultaneously and independently. Along with it, a multiplayer party game with up to sixty players, based on “Fall Guys”, was also developed.

portfolio.title: Backup Surgeons
portfolio.desc: Local multiplayer surgery game for up to four players. The inexperienced surgeons must work as a team in a chaotic environment to perform surgery on several patients before the time runs out.

archive.title: Negotiations Platform
archive.desc: Console app that allows manufacturers to negotiate with producers on orders. A manufacturer can place a request for a product on the platform, while the producers can place an offer to their request.

archive.title: Messaging Platform
archive.desc: A console app based on message publication and subscription to relevant topics, like “Twitter”. Users can post messages tagged with a topic or search for a certain topic and obtain the ten latest posted messages.

archive.title: Decentralized Aggregation
archive.desc: Python program that implements a decentralized aggregation (extrema propagation) algorithm into a network of nodes to know its approximated dimension.
